title: George Michael's former boyfriend Fadi Fawaz claims the singer was HIV positive
text:
Fadi Fawaz has claimed George Michael was HIV positive at the time of his death

George Michael's former boyfriend Fadi Fawaz today claimed the Freedom singer was HIV positive.

In a Twitter rant this morning unemployed Mr Fawaz, 46, also claimed his late lover did not write his own songs.

At 8.41am today Mr Fawaz, who last month was reportedly sleeing rough on the streets of London after being thrown out of Michael's £5m home, tweeted: 'George Micheal was HIV+'.

He followed up his unsubstaniated claim saying: 'We found out in Vienna after his illness.'

Mr Fawaz, whose Twitter bio reads simply 'I will never stop missing you xxx' then went on to allege: 'He never wrote his own music he paid other people to make the music for him and pretended it was him. Not so talented after all ..'

He followed up the allegation with a selfie, insisting his account had not been hacked and proving it was he who was sending the tweets.

This morning starting at 8.41am Fawaz claimed his former lover, whose surname he misspelled, was an HIV positive fraud

He followed up his accusations with a pair of tweets proving his account had not been hacked

George Michael and Fadi Fawaz pictured walking arm in arm through Soho in happier times

Earlier this month Andrew Ridgley, Michael's WHAM! co-star, revealed in his autobiography that Michael refused to come out even after his boyfriend Anselmo Feleppa died from AIDS in 1993.

Ridgeley said that it had 'devastated' the star but he had been 'unable to discuss it in public'.

'Had he spoken out earlier, who knows how differently things might have played out,' Ridgley said.

Last month it emerged Mr Fawaz was reportedly homeless after moving out of the £49-a-night budget hotel he lived in after being chucked out of the late singer's £5million house.

The 46-year-old former celebrity hairdresser had checked into the hotel in Covent Garden after he allegedly 'went beserk' and smashed in the windows of his ex's exclusive Regent's Park property last month.

In a Facebook post he told friends he had become homeless, as reported by The Sun.

He said: 'George Michael the ikon (sic) 3 years later and his lawyers still not done anything to sort me out so in last few days I have been sleeping in the street in Covent Garden instead of being in my home.'
description: Unemployed and homeless Fawaz, 46, claimed the Freedom songwriter was HIV+ and did not write his own songs. Fawaz was thrown out of Michael's £5m London home last month.
